name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: The Persian Spread
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you The Persian Spread by Chef Nasrin KarimiExperience the warm and vibrant flavors of Persian cuisine as Tijouri hosts a special pop-up with Chef Nasrin. Known for her authentic and heartfelt cooking, Chef Nasrin brings the essence of traditional Persian dishes to life, offering a unique dining experience you won’t want to miss.MENU:Amuse bouche NOONO PANEER: vegetarian bite walnut feta cheese with oilve n tomato n lettuce Starters Vegetarian Hummus crunchy pitaMASTO BADEMJAN: Eggplant dip Non-VegetarianKOBIDEH KABAB: Mutton kababTORSH KABAB:  chicken kabab with pomegranate puree n walnutMains:Vegetarian Platter GHEIMEH - Chickpeas stew with dried Lemon n saffron served with orange peel rice. FESENJAN - a traditional stew made of pomegranate n walnut served with saffron riceNon - Vegetarian PlatterESHKENEH- gravy made of potatoes n fenugreek eaten with naanKHORESHT-E BADEMJAN - eggplant with mutton served with Naan or dill riceALOOBOKHARA - plum chickenMEIGOO - prawn in fresh cream n herbsDessertsTARHALVA -Persian custard with pure rose water n pistachios n saffron NOON NOKHODCHI - Chickpeas cookies with shiraz tea Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

location.address: 1, Palace Rd, Ambedkar Veedhi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: Apéro Dînatoire with Chef Arpitha
description: An Evening of French Plant-Based Fine Dining 🇫🇷✨Join us at the Studio by Copper + Cloves for an unforgettable culinary experience with our guest chef, Chef Arpitha., who has travelled from Lyon, France. Discover the art of French fine dining—completely plant-based and reimagined in the most exquisite way. The event is a rare opportunity to indulge in apéro dînatoire - a French tasting menu alongside cocktails.An Apéro dînatoire is a French culinary tradition that combines the concepts of a cocktail/ aperitif (apéro) and a light dinner (dînatoire). It’s essentially a relaxed, yet elegant gathering where guests enjoy a variety of small, bite-sized dishes and drinks. Think of it as a sophisticated blend of a cocktail party and a tapas-style meal, where the focus is on flavorful, creative, and beautifully presented finger foods that are filling enough to replace a full dinner.We'll be serving C+C's signature zero-proof cocktails alongside Chef Arpitha's bite-sized food: here’s a sneak peek of the menu:	•	Tartare	•	Risotto	•	Panisse	•	Gâteau Provençale •	Terrine	•	Moelleux aux Amandes	•	Riz au Lait	•	Spaces are limited for this intimate 'cocktail party' experience, so book your spot now and treat yourself to an evening of flavour, creativity, and elegance.This is a great place to meet new people! The dishes in an apéro dînatoire are designed to be enjoyed while mingling, creating a convivial and intimate dining experience. It’s all about savoring the food, the drinks, and the company without the formality of a sit-down meal. Arpitha is a chef based in Lyon, France, currently serving as Head Chef at Like an Elephant, a vegan fine dining restaurant.Growing up in a traditional vegetarian family, she was immersed in Ayurveda, one of the world’s oldest sciences, known for its holistic approach to food and lifestyle. A lifelong animal lover, Arpitha has always been driven to create positive change. Embracing veganism gave her a clear vision: to inspire others to enjoy plant-based, delicious food. A passionate foodie, she dreamed of sharing recipes close to her heart. This dream led her to leave a corporate career in India, and dedicate her life to showing the world that incredible meals can be created without animal-based ingredients. Her journey as a chef began in the gastronomy capital of the world, France. Arpitha has honed her craft working in esteemed restaurants across Lyon and the South of France, including the first Michelin-starred establishment to offer a 100% gluten-free and plant-based menu, renowned for its commitment to sustainability.Sustainability is a cornerstone of Arpitha’s culinary philosophy. Guided by her deep respect for nature, she exclusively uses natural, seasonal, and locally-sourced ingredients. Through her dishes, she tells a story rooted in her vibrant culinary heritage, offering diners not just a meal, but an immersive journey through rich, layered flavors.Her cuisine is deeply inspired by her grandmother’s recipes from the two countries she calls home: India and France.

name: Friday Workday Deli Counter
description: Friday Deli CounterWant to spend a day in the heart of Bangalore on a work-day sipping on a drink and enjoying the beautiful tree-tops view? Come spend a working day with us at the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Our members find that they are more productive than usual at this space. This Friday we are opening out the space beyond our members, for an open-day with a delicious, nourishing spread!Launching the "Friday - Workday Deli Counter". Nourish yourself at our ‘all you can eat’ deli counter and work from our beautiful cafe/co-working space at the Studio that is normally a members-only space!

name: The Wellness Day Retreat
description: Welcome to the first ever Wellness Day Retreat at the Studio.The intention of this retreat is help the attendees to leave feeling a sense of companionship and clarity on their wellness journey. Our goal is for them to feel seen in their struggles, let go of the pressure to "race" toward wellness, and embrace the belief that they are enough, just as they are.Event FlowOpening CircleWelcome and grounding and breathworkAcknowledge the "wellness race" and share the event’s purpose.Set intentions using a prompt like: “What’s one thing about wellness you’d like to unlearn?”Gentle movement practice (stretching/mindful walking).Movement PracticeGentle wellness activity: yin yoga, guided meditation, or breathwork.Sharing CircleOpen with personal reflections on "wellness check boxing."Encourage shared experiences to foster connection.Mindful DinnerIntroduce mindful eating by Chef Sarah - Founder of Copper + Cloves.Quiet, introspective space by the window for those who prefer solitude.Closing CirclePopcorn-style or paired reflections.Connection Corner ElementsPalo Santo for cleansing.Journaling materials and prompts.Aromatherapy with essential oils.Relaxation tools: candles, eye covers, tarot cards.Nourishment: fresh fruit.We’re excited to host you and nurture a holistic approach to wellness in this beautiful space.

name: Woodcutprinting  Beginner's Workshop
description: Woodcut is a relief printing technique in printmaking. The participants carve an image into the surface of a block of wood—typically with gouges—leaving the printing parts level with the surface while removing the non-printing parts. Areas that the artist cuts away carry no ink, while characters or images at surface level carry the ink to produce the print.All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.The size of the block is A4 . You take home your carved block with 2 prints.We’ll be teaching a black and white composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you can choose from the references we have.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

name: Colour Reduction Woodcut Printing Workshop
description: Color-reduction woodcut is a traditional and much more complicated form of printmaking which allows the artist to create editionable multi-colored prints. With this method, a single block is carved and printed successively resulting in an edition of identical prints.Colour reduction woodcut printing workshop(2 day workshop)Fees: Rs. 3750All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch. You take home your carved block with 2 prints. The size of the block is A4.We’ll be teaching colour reduction woodcut. You will be printing a colour woodcut with two or three layers of colour depending on the composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you choose from the references we have.Please keep in mind to choose a simple composition. Avoid compositions that require a lot of intricate carving.Please reach the venue by 11am. Avoid wearing light coloured clothes.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

name: A 2 Day Natural Fitness Kalaripayattu Workshop
description: We are hosting a 2-day Live Kalaripayattu workshop on 15th & 16 Feb 2025 (Saturday & Sunday)We are bringing to you Specially curated exercises inspired from Kalaripayattu that can be practised at the comfort of your home.What's included in the Workshop:A 2 Day Live workshop provided by Experienced Kalaripayattu Teachers on 15th & 16 Feb 2025 eachThere would be 1.5 hours of a Online session 1 week prior to the workshop to brief you about the workshop and to provide Theoretical Introduction to the Kalaripayattu movements and to address other question and answers.Support through whatsapp / Call in future.This workshop is open for both Adults and Kids. There movements would be different and according to the respective age groupsBenefits of attending this Workshop:Learn Scientific , Natural Kalaripayattu Movements as a fitness routine to include in your day to day Lifestyle (no equipments required)Improve Mental Focus & MindfulnessDevelop A Stronger, Healthier Spine

name: Courtyard Baithak | An Evening of Ghazals
description: About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the artistsUstaad Faiyaz KhanUstad Faiyaz Khan is known for preserving the purity of raagas, blending the lyrical "Gayaki Ang" with the intricate "Tantrakari Ang." A master of vocals and sarangi in the Kirana Gharana, he is an “A” Grade A.I.R Artist, a celebrated composer, and a recipient of numerous awards. His collaborations with legends and global performances reflect his exceptional musicianship and dedication to tradition.Accompanied byTrilochan kampli on TablaSarfaraz Khan on SarangiAnd, Sandeep Pillai on GuitarThis event is supported by Samagata Foundation.Terms and Conditions1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.5. Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.8. In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Love finds it's way
description: Find the love within that you seek around. Nupur Bahuguna & Dimpy Fadhya Welcome you to an inmersive experiential workshop where we will perform : Intention setting : As we speak, we attractConnect with the love consciousness to tap into the ocean of love that fills you up.Setting our unified and individual intentions we begin our workshop. Breathwork Undo & let go of the barriers that you have built against the love you seek Letting go of the conditioning and thoughts that keeps one in chasing energies rather than attracting. Chakra Frequency Alignment Working and balancing of Heart and Root chakras through Frequency AlignmentTo become aligned with the energies of Love with in us and releasing the fear of judgement Guided meditations Tap into our highest, abundant and most loving version of self Fall in love with ourselves to attract better.  Connect with the true joy, love and abundance within us.
